availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alfred Gosney (Morgan County, Indiana, blacksmith and resident)

body.p: Morgan County, Indiana, blacksmith and resident. Kentucky native. Married to Lucy Hawes Gosney in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on May 14, 1818. Father of Margaret Gosney Hancock, Margaret S. Gosney Callender, John Gosney, Catherine Gosney, Richard Gosney, Julia Gosney, and Newton Gosney. Blacksmith in Oldham County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Oldham County in 1850. Employed Achilles Callender as a blacksmith in Oldham County in 1850. Resident of Morgan County, Indiana, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
